revised_title: The Influence of Phase Changes on the Tenacity of Ductile Metals
tldr: This study investigates the influence of phase changes on the tenacity of ductile metals at ordinary temperatures and the boiling point of liquid air. The authors found that the metals' tenacity is affected by the changes in phase, and the amorphous phase is harder than the crystalline phase. They also discovered that the metals' maximum tenacity can be achieved when they are in a homogeneous condition.
